page.title: 09Oldmeldrum Trunk Routes
page.content: Oldmeldrum lies on the ede of the Thanage of Formartine and the Earldom of the Garioch (pron. Geeree) and has always been a crossroads for east-west and north-south traffic. Goods vehicles from the east coast (Ellon and Peterhead) travel through the town on the A.920 to Huntly and the distillery district and on the B.9170 to Inverurie. Traffic also pours through the town from Banff and the north coast on the A.947 turnpike to Aberdeen. Because of increased traffic in the last decade, plans are underway to upgrade the Oldmeldrum- Inverurie road (B.9170) to category A. Residents have recently written concerned letters about the quantity of heavy traffic causing vibration and damage to 200 year old buildings in the town centre but there are no immediate plans for a bypass.
